results.name: Number T(n,k) of set partitions of [n] such that the maximal value of all absolute differences between least elements of consecutive blocks and between consecutive elements within the blocks equals k; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=max(n-1,0), read by rows.
comment: The maximal value is assumed to be zero if there are no consecutive blocks and no consecutive elements.
T(n,k) is defined for all n,k >= 0. The triangle contains only the terms for k <= max(n-1,0). T(n,k) = 0 if k>=n and k>0.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..23, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, k, l, t) option remember; `if`(n<1, 1, `if`(t-n>k, 0,
b(n-1, k, sort(map(x-> `if`(x-n>=k, [][], x), subsop(j=n, l))),
mathematica: b[n_, k_, l_, t_] := b[n, k, l, t] = If[n < 1, 1, If[t - n > k, 0, b[n - 1, k, If[# - n >= k, Nothing, #]& /@ Append[l, n], n]] + Sum[b[n - 1, k, Sort[If[# - n >= k, Nothing, #]& /@ ReplacePart[l, j -> n]], If[t - n > k, Infinity, t]], {j, 1, Length[l]}]];
